benchmark_details.name: A BENCHMARK FOR VERICODING
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents and tests the largest benchmark for vericoding, LLM-generation of formally verified code from formal specifications, containing 12,504 formal specifications.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark expansion for formal specifications to support automation of formal verification and vericoding.

data.source: Curated from various formal verification benchmarks and vibe coding datasets.
data.annotation: Tasks are curated and quality-checked based on algorithm specifications.

methodology.calculation: Success rates are calculated based on the proportion of tasks completed successfully using LLMs.
methodology.interpretation: A high success rate indicates the effectiveness of the benchmark and task difficulty.
methodology.validation: Manual inspection of a sample of outputs for verification success.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data is anonymized and does not contain personal information.
